org.webpki.jce.crypto
Class CryptoDriver

java.lang.Object
  org.webpki.jce.crypto.CryptoDriver

public class CryptoDriver
extends Object

This class is the bridge between the cryptographic high-level functions and the Security Element.

provisionPiggybackedSymmetricKey

public static byte[] provisionPiggybackedSymmetricKey(String piggyback_mac_algorithm,
                                                      byte[] encrypted_symmetric_key,
                                                      byte[] private_key_handle,
                                                      org.webpki.crypto.AsymEncryptionAlgorithms encryption_algorithm,
                                                      String[] endorsed_algorithms,
                                                      byte[] declared_mac,
                                                      byte[] nonce)
                                               throws IOException
Provisions a KeyGen2 "piggybacked" symmetric key. Below is an example: 
  <PiggybackedSymmetricKey EndorsedAlgorithms="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#hmac-sha1"
                           MAC="14z1RfdoVeDqYfSviPWZD4c2AL4=">
      <xenc:EncryptedKey>
          <xenc:EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5"/>
          <xenc:CipherData>
              <xenc:CipherValue>VA2TbKUq...HQk9HoOIwCeSs=</xenc:CipherValue>
          </xenc:CipherData>
      </xenc:EncryptedKey>
  </PiggybackedSymmetricKey>

Parameters:
encrypted_symmetric_key - The encrypted data as featured in the "CipherValue" element.
private_key_handle - The sealed private key associated with the public key certificate holding the "PiggybackedSymmetricKey" element.
encryption_algorithm - The XML encryption "Algorithm".
endorsed_algorithms - The "EndorsedAlgorithms" as declared in the "PiggybackedSymmetricKey" element where the algorithm URIs have been sorted in alphabetical order.
declared_mac - The "MAC" as declared in the "PiggybackedSymmetricKey" element. The declared_mac must match the HMAC-SHA1 value of the UTF-8 encoded string of "EndorsedAlgorithms" with the whitespace removed, where the algorithm URIs have been sorted in lexical order and where each algorithm URI has been appended by a '\0' character. The decrypted symmetric key is used as HMAC input key.
Returns:
A sealed symmetric key.
Throws:
IOException
